content.description: Start with small sharp holds. Two or three technical moves on more sharp holds and you are on the top.
content.location: On the Fin Boulder downhill from Le Beak

content.description: The slabby counterpart to Steven's other FA on the same boulder, Treeage shares a common start with Heelside (V5) on the undercling sloper section. Rather than cutting right after the start, cut left towards the slab. Navigate vertical slots and slopey pockets to a standing rest about midway up the arete on the right side. The climbing eases off at the top, but a fall could be sketchy with the ground sloping downhill and the tree for which the route is named.
content.location: Downhill behind Le Beak on the Fin Boulder. Two current routes are visible from the Le Beak/Mikey's Corridor area (Tweak the Beak is one). Once by the boulder, go right around the back side of the boulder. A large undercling feature will be jutting out at you- that's the start for both Treeage and Heelside.

content.description: Sit start at the back of the roof and climb straight back out the roof to a tall buy moderate top out. Scramble down to climbers left.There are two ways to overcome the roof: 1. keep going left, you will get to the lip via a bad right hand pocket-sloper and a big, off balance throw. 2. head right at the lip and either execute a painful but bomber fingerlock pull through or bump, or dyno past it.Both methods feel about the same, difficulty-wise. though the movement is very different, almost like two different problems.
content.location: Top Hat Boulder

content.description: Consistent grade, good warmup.
content.location: Right side of Spooge Boulder.  Follow the good holds to a break, and top out.

content.description:
Sit start same as Broken Bottles, matched on the crimp near the left end of the wall under the low roof (almost lying down).Of the 2 crimps, the left one is large enough for 2 hands and imo slightly better for the right hand than the right crimp, so I started on that one.Crimp up the first short arete bulge to the horizontal jug crack, then come directly out the roof and over the bulge, staying completely to the right of the lip slopers/topout holds of Broken Bottles, but staying left of the protruding “diving board” portion of the right side of the lip of the graffiti boulder.

PS- I highly doubt this is my first ascent, but I just named it this because “Broken Bottles Right” sounds lame
content.location: Same sit start as Broken Bottles, start on crimp under low roof near the left end of the graffiti boulder.

content.description: Second only to Le Beak, and an absolute moderate classic in its own right!  Sit start and climb the perfect prow-like arete, pass the mystery eye, and rocket straight up to Uranus!
content.location: On the obvious prow of the Uranus boulder.

content.description: Same start as Rings of Uranus, go right and up.
content.location: Uranus Boulder.

content.description: Rings' little brother.  This is a decent little problem that I'm sure has been done before, but I have never seen any information on it.  Start sitting, right hand on the left hand for the Hulk, left hand in an obvious small hueco on the arête (or both hands in the small hueco if you can reach/make it work, as I couldn't).  a quick left hand bump to the jug sidepull leads to nice movement with crimps, heel hooks, and sidepulls up the arête. Once reaching a right hand crimp near the sidepull used on rings, reach left to a fat jug and easy topout.
content.location: Would be the first problem approached when entering the first corridor with rings of Uranus. It is left of the hulk, with which it shares a start hold. it is on the same boulder as rings of Uranus and the start is about 8 feet to the left, around the arête.

content.description: Sit-Start, then angle up to the right.
content.location: On "Juvenile Wall" boulder, directly right of the parking area. Left-most problem.

content.description: Sit start at the back and climb straight out and up the roof
content.location: Planet Roof

content.description: Start at the back of the roof as for Privileged Planet but move straight out and to the right onto slopers around the lip.  Climb up and over on slopers to the top.
content.location: Planet Roof

content.description: Climb the orange arete to a tricky topout. Good warmup problem.
content.location: Head down the path into the boulders from the parking area. Immediately on your right will be a corridor. This route is on the left arete at the beginning of this corridor.

content.description: A short and technical problem that will force you to use a little power. This one is tricky, so don't read on if you want to sort it out by yourself. Start with small cimps for your hands in the roof, your right foot pushing, and a weird heel-toe on the left. You basically do the whole problem by pulling hard on the left foot.The crux move is the first move. finish up and left on bigger edges to a couple of jugs. Drop from here.Most people don't seem to like it all that much, but I thought it was great.
content.location: As you walk back toward Le Beak, past Rings of Uranus, look for a corridor on the left. This problem is hidden within, on the right side, and is obvious for its steepness and small crimps. It looks like its going to be v11 until you find the heel-toe.Start on a super low, chalky shelf.

content.description: Sit start on the left side of the roof, work rightways on the crack, topping out on the right side.
content.protection: It's only about 4 feet off the ground.
content.location: This is the obvious crack under the graffiti'd roof as you enter the area

content.description: Start on decent holds and make a powerful move to a bumpy pocket. There seems to be a lot of start options, none of them feeling very good.  Move higher onto sidepulls, find the good feet, and go for it.
content.location: Back side of the spooge boulder. Facing Center Spooge, head right, scramble around the side and there is Mill's lane.

content.description: A couple moves off the ground land you at the bottom of the amazing juggy-looking runnel. This one stays on you with committing moves well above the pad. Top notch, and do not take this one lightly.
content.location: While facing Eat Your Oatmeal and the other problems Mikey's Corridor, look to the right and find the obvious, tall runnel. Look down to find the start jugs.

content.description: Start on a deep incut, move up and right to some nasty looking holds, followed by a sloper then the finishing rail. powerful problem with friction dependent holds. drop off/no top out
content.location: In the Mikey's corridor area. When facing the wall with the majority of routes in Mikey's corridor, this problem is in the center of the corridor directly behind you.

content.description: Left side of the tall Spooge Boulder.  Start on jugs up to a triangle crimp and then the long reach over the bulge.
content.location: Spooge Boulder

content.description: Start mached on the juggy sidepull at the base of the boulder, make a desperate move put left to a jug, and work your way up on good holds. Top-Out on the right of the boulder.
content.location: When walking to the area with Planet Earth V5 (which will be on your right), take a left turn and walk down the trail about 30ft. Le Phat will be on your left.

content.description: Five Stars + . . . Seriously.  This is why God/Buddha/Allah/Mother-Earth made the V4 grade--maybe the best anywhere.  Start on crimps at the low right arete of the formation.  Decode the straightforward-to-heaven sequence all the way out Le Beak to the world's highest friction sloper!
content.location: This is the whole reason you came to FOUNTAIN RED--you don't need me to tell you!

content.description: Follow the jugs to a slightly harder top-out.
content.location: On "Juvenile Wall" boulder, directly right of the parking area. Right of "Prom Queen".

content.description: This is simply the sit start to "Juvenile".
content.location: Directly right of "Prom Queen".

content.description: Sit start on opposing side pull crimps and make a big deadpoint move to the 1-1.5 pad uncut rail, then reach right and finish on Rings of Uranus (the arête)
content.location: Rings boulder

content.description: Start left of the arete behind Mikey's Corridor. Move up the huecoed face via a series of slopey underclings and not-as-positve-as-they-look pockets.  A little more traffic will turn this one into a warm up classic.
content.location: Start left of the arete behind Mikey's Corridor, and move up the obvious huecoed face for a Zeppelin delight!

content.description: Sit start on the right side of the wall and bust out through the roof onto crimps. Pull a maybe sandy mantel and it's over.
content.protection: Pad/Spot...it's pretty low to the ground
content.location: Right side of graffiti wall, the obvious boulder as you first enter Fountain Red

content.description: From the common undercling start with Treeage, go up and to the right, slapping the arete as needed on the way up. Using a tricky heelhook on the right unlocks the low crux of the route. Keep it together for the easier, but slightly heady shared topout for Treeage- straight up the corner of the two routes. Because of the downhill slant, a fall high may be difficult to protect.
content.location: Downhill behind Le Beak on the Fin Boulder. Two current routes are visible from the Le Beak/Mikey's Corridor area (Tweak the Beak is one). Once by the boulder, go right around the back side of the boulder. A large undercling feature will be jutting out at you- that's the start for both Treeage and Heelside.

content.description: Another quality addition to the lower graded problems at Font, this one featuring a sloper crux topout straight out of HP40.  Start with a nice choice of holds around chest high and a squat start.  there are many options for start holds and feet, but I preferred two opposing sidepull jugs.  the rock is better than it looks.  make a move or two or three to get a meathook on a sloper jug above the break, then launch into some sloper slapping and high stepping until you can reach a left side pull sloper that enables the topout. The problem has a large amount of great foot options, which is what keeps the grade low. with worse feet, this would be an excellent moderate tech problem, but it sits as a super fun low-grade sloper problem.
content.location: When standing at the main campsite and fire ring (last one before the corridor with rings of Uranus), face down hill. This problem is on the downhill side of the first big boulder you see (the boulder is almost on the trail).  follow the boulder around and down hill, the problem is on the most downhill point.  the start holds are just to the left of a large tree that is growing into the rock.

content.description: In the corridor directly behind Mikey's corridor. Sit Start on the left side of the wall on and move up through an obvious left gaston and right facing rail.
content.location: In the Mikey's corridor area. When facing the wall with the majority of routes in Mikey's corridor, this problem is on the left side of the corridor directly behind you.

content.description: Start on Gak, traverse over to and top out on Rings of Uranus
Big jugs and pockets at the corner, move up the broad arete.
content.location: Uranus Boulder.

content.description: Crux is a longish move to a slopey hold near the top
content.location: Right in front of the Fountain Red parking area.

content.description: start on the V0 arete, traverse right on good holds and top out.
content.location: On the short boulder near Rings around Uranus.   If looking at rings, this is the boulder directly behind you.

content.description: sit start on jug rail making tough moves through opposing sidepulls.  finish on obvious drop off jug
content.location: mikey's Corridor just left of "Be Like Mikey"

content.description: Left side of Spooge Boulder, sit start, move up the arete to the top out.
content.location: Spooge Boulder.

content.description: Sound intriguing but not all that pleasurable?  That's about right.  Climb the obvious crack just right of "Houses of the Holy."  Climb up the crack on what actually looks something like a stegauras's ass (crack)!
content.location: At the very end of the main rock at Fountain Red.  Just behind all the Mikey's Corridor routes.  Start 6 feet right of "Houses of the Holy" in the obvious crack by the arete.

content.description: Center of the tall Spooge Boulder.  Climb the crimps to the top.
content.location: Spooge Boulder

content.description: Sit start matched on the crimp near the left end of the wall under the low roof (almost lying down).Don’t know for sure which of the 2 crimps the FAist started on (perhaps both?), but the left one is large enough for 2 hands and imo slightly better for the right hand than the right crimp, so I started on that one.Crimp up the first short arete bulge to the horizontal jug crack, then cut left to the slopers at the lip and top out from there.
content.location: Near the left end of the graffiti roof

content.description: Locate the short arete and sit-start.
content.location: Directly across from Uranus Boulder and "Rings of Uranus", low lying boulder.

content.description: An actual quality addition to the lower graded problems at font red. start kind of squatting on a pretty obvious rail above a break. there is a crimp feature on the rail that I used for a right hand.  Use any feet and move up and left to the fat sloper. tic-tac sloping crimps and the large sloper to get to another sloper out left. nice pull up to a flat hold up and right, then the climbing eases off.  All moss has been well cleaned and this thing is ready to send! look for a nice sloper top out jug up and right that is kind of hard to see.  Problem looks tall but the top is pretty easy, and it has an easy bail out to the left.
content.location: It is an arête in the corridor between rings of Uranus and planet earth. If you are looking at planet earth, it is just to the right past some saplings.  Look for the big sloper on the arête.

content.description: Always thought a line could go up here. Waiting for folks to show, I brushed this guy off.  Turns out it climbs pretty well actually!Start low on the lowest rail with a heel hook on the same rail.  Crux is getting to the good holds up top, but some balance is required to top out on the slopers!
content.location: Campground area.  Left of the hero jump campfire on that same little band of rock.

content.description:
The Fontainebleau of Arkansas--the Fountaine Red!!   

  Fountaine Red has a high concentration of top notch boulder problems, free camping, and a nice remote setting in the Ozarks. The uber-classic Le Beak may be the best V4 in the world, and that is just the beginning.  With Fred's Cave, The Power Wall, The Invasion, and more within short walking distance, it is arguable that the Fountaine Red area is one of the best destination bouldering areas in the United States with something for everyone on perfect Southern Sandstone.
